title: 111_s1817
content: The "Small Business Emergency Loan Relief Act of 2009" allows for a temporary increase in maximum loan amounts and the use of refinances. The "Small Business Emergency Loan Relief Act of 2009" temporarily increases maximum loan amounts for 7(a) and 504 programs. The Small Business Emergency Loan Relief Act of 2009 raises maximum loan limits for the microloan program and low-interest refinancing under the local development business loan program. Loan limits are increased from $35,000 to $50,000 in various clauses. The Small Business Emergency Loan Relief Act of 2009 raises maximum loan limits for the microloan program and low-interest refinancing under the local development business loan program. Loan limits are increased from $35,000 to $50,000. Additionally, refinancing not involving expansions allows existing indebtedness to be refinanced and added to the project cost under certain conditions. The Small Business Emergency Loan Relief Act of 2009 raises maximum loan limits for the microloan program and low-interest refinancing under the local development business loan program. Existing indebtedness can be refinanced and added to the project cost under certain conditions, including not being incurred during the 2-year period ending on the date of financing and not being guaranteed by any Federal agency. Borrowers may need to pay a fee for additional costs determined by the Administrator. The Business Stabilization Program under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 increases the loan limit to $50,000. During a specified period, fees for loans guaranteed under the Small Business Act are waived. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 waives fees for certain institutions under specific sections. The Administrator will collect no fee for loan guarantees or projects subject to the subsection. Additionally, there is a prospective repeal of maximum loan amounts under the Small Business Act. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amending maximum loan amounts under the 504 program, reducing the limits to $1,500,000 and $2,000,000 respectively. The Small Business Act is amending maximum loan limits under the microloan program, reducing the amounts from $50,000 to $35,000. Additionally, low interest refinancing under the local development business loan program is being amended from $50,000 to $35,000. The Small Business Act is amending loan limits under the microloan program, reducing amounts from $50,000 to $35,000. Effective January 1, 2011, certain amendments will take effect.
